citations.narrative:
Approximately half of the litters of puppies did not have cage cards and thus were not officially identified. Complete and
accurate identification of all dogs and puppies are necessary for proper management and traceability of the animals. Live
puppies or kittens, less than 16 weeks of age, shall be identified by: An official tag as described in § 2.51, a distinctive and
legible tattoo marking approved by the Administrator, a plastic-type collar acceptable to the Administrator which has
legibly placed thereon the information required for an official tag pursuant to Sec. 2.51 or cage card attached to the
enclosure that identifies the puppies with the female and to include all required information of the litter.
Correct by 12 Dec. 2024

The licensees Record of Acquisition and Dogs on Hand form (APHIS form 7005) is not accurate and up-to-date to reflect
the current listing of dogs in the kennel at the time of the inspection. Some dogs listed on the forms are no longer present
in the kennel, 4 puppies older than 16 weeks of age are not listed on the form and several dogs purchased months ago
are also not listed on the form. Complete and accurate records for all dogs present in the kennel must be maintained in
order to ensure that each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate the movement of animals. The
licensee must ensure all of the information required on APHIS form 7005 is recorded for all of the dogs in the kennel.
Correct by 5 Jan. 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Approximately half of the litters of puppies did not have cage cards and thus were not officially identified. Complete and 
accurate identification of all dogs and puppies are necessary for proper management and traceability of the animals. Live 
puppies or kittens, less than 16 weeks of age, shall be identified by: An official tag as described in § 2.51, a distinctive and 
legible tattoo marking approved by the Administrator, a plastic-type collar acceptable to the Administrator which has 
legibly placed thereon the information required for an official tag pursuant to Sec. 2.51 or cage card attached to the 
enclosure that identifies the puppies with the female and to include all required information of the litter. 
Correct by 12 Dec. 2024 
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensees Record of Acquisition and Dogs on Hand form (APHIS form 7005) is not accurate and up-to-date to reflect 
the current listing of dogs in the kennel at the time of the inspection. Some dogs listed on the forms are no longer present 
in the kennel, 4 puppies older than 16 weeks of age are not listed on the form and several dogs purchased months ago 
are also not listed on the form. Complete and accurate records for all dogs present in the kennel must be maintained in 
order to ensure that each animal's identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate the movement of animals. The 
licensee must ensure all of the information required on APHIS form 7005 is recorded for all of the dogs in the kennel. 
Correct by 5 Jan. 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
